DOC.HEAD: Christmas Eve Storm Kills 1 in Australia
DOC.TEXT: A storm with high winds and torrential rains swept through the Brisbane area on Sunday, killing one person, damaging homes, uprooting trees and leaving 45,000 homes without power. In some southern suburbs of the city in eastern Australia, three inches of rain fell in 15 minutes, police said. An unidentified woman died when her boat overturned off Bribie Island, 35 miles north of Brisbane. Her body was recovered Sunday night by police divers. The storm struck a wide area around Brisbane, uprooting trees, damaging cars and houses, and overturning light aircraft at an airport. Crews restoring electricity in Brisbane said some homes would have to do without power until Christmas morning.
